title: Understanding Le Chatelier’s Principle
text: Le Chatelier’s principle states that if a dynamic equilibrium is disturbed by changing the conditions, the position of equilibrium shifts to counteract the change and re-establish equilibrium.

title: Effect of Adding Reactants
text: When you add more reactant to a system at equilibrium, the system will try to reduce the effect of this change. Think about which direction the reaction will shift to consume the added reactant.

hintAnswer: The equilibrium shifts in the direction that consumes some of the added reactant.
title: Direction of Equilibrium Shift
text: If more reactant is added to the system, the equilibrium will shift in the direction that consumes the added reactant. Which direction is this?
choices: The equilibrium shifts in the direction that consumes some of the added reactant.
The equilibrium always shifts to produce more reactant.
The equilibrium constant changes to a new value.
Nothing changes because the system is already at equilibrium.
